author: gcolvin
content:
This used to be my neighborhood grocery store.  It still is my brother's.  When asked how many were killed all the police will say is "We are still processing the crime scene."  District Attorney says family are being notified first, and there will be more information with 2 or 3 hours.  My brother and his family are fine, not sure about all of our friends.

https://www.9news.com/article/news/crime/shooting-boulder-king-soopers-table-mesa/73-f5825a61-8b9b-4b5a-a550-36edf1c44d50

author: gcolvin
content:
Local videographer happened to be entering store as shooting was unfolding.  There were three bodies on the ground.  Police reported only person in hospital - the suspect.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ikujTMetrUk&feature=youtu.be

author: sky.cactus
content: This is wildly off topic...

author: gcolvin
content: Not for me it isn't.  And some of my best friends are here. (I did just remove garish embeds.)

author: chris2_2_2
content: So sorry to see that I hope there ok.

author: gcolvin
content: Thanks, <@!636289909359116290>.  They just confirmed 10 dead.  Puts my troubles here in perspective.

author: chris2_2_2
content: I‚Äôm so sorry to hear that. Indeed so many awful things happen in the world and all we can do is just remember them and move forward with our lives as we work to improve it. <@683653554631868440> I‚Äôm glad to hear your family is ok and I hope you treasure your moments with them.

author: definitelynotcharles7176
content:
While it is terrible that this happened in a story with an association with you, it's unclear how you are directly affected.

Unfortunately many people die every day in the US, and many more around the world.

It seems like if you put this in <#595721451651465227> you would get more direct sympathy and more condolences.

author: gcolvin
content: <@!687535760965894191> For all I knew my brother was in that store.  We still don't whether there are friends among the dead.  I'm directly affected.  I wasn't seeking condolences. My emotional state is indeed fragile right now.  Forgive my intrusion.

author: holgerd77
content: EthereumJS Berlin HF releases are now out, most notably are a Berlin-ready VM and the Transaction library now supporting EIP-2930 Typed Transactions: https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/releases

author: timbeiko
content: Nice! To be clear, this means EthereumJS can _accept_ 2930 transactions, but not generate access lists, correct?

author: holgerd77
content: <@!552133098075193354> yes, that's correct! We have an issue for this open though https://github.com/ethereumjs/ethereumjs-monorepo/issues/1152 , we can prioritize if wished, this might be useful for web tools, eventually also MetaMask (I guess I'll just directly reach out and ask).

author: holgerd77
content: Update: respectively I guess we'll prioritize anyhow, this is not a dramatic amount of work and I guess this *will* be useful in some contexts.

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah, I think it would be super helpful to have tools we can point the community to that help easily generate acecss lists

author: holgerd77
content: Respectively I am just realizing that it's relatively easy for us to have our VM generate access lists on *some* state - there the prerequisites are more or less there - it's a bit different to operate on the real mainnet state though. So we can provide this as a dev tool, for the use case to actually send or prepare mainnet txs (e.g. for MetaMask) I am not sure atm. Think we need to give this some more thought.

author: holgerd77
content: (so I'll take a bit a step back, don't want to overpromise here)

author: timbeiko
content: Got it üëç
